metadata.title: CVE-2022-0561 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Null source pointer passed as an argument to memcpy() function within TIFFFetchStripThing() in tif_dirread.c in libtiff versions from 3.9.0 to 4.3.0 could lead to Denial of Service via crafted TIFF file. For users that compile libtiff from sources, the fix is available with commit eecb0712.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-0561` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
libtiff-tools - 4.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
libtiff5 - 4.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
libtiffxx5 - 4.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-1ubuntu0.1').
